name: Social Influence
description: Rules for social interaction, NPC attitudes, and influencing creatures through conversation in D&D 2024.

npcAttitudes.description: A Hostile creature opposes the adventurers and their goals but doesn't necessarily attack them on sight. The creature might try to undermine the characters, hinder their plans, or work against them.
npcAttitudes.successResult: The creature becomes Indifferent for 1d4 hours.
npcAttitudes.failureConsequence: The creature remains Hostile and may become more aggressive.

npcAttitudes.description: An Indifferent creature might help or hinder the party, depending on what it considers in its best interest. Most NPCs start with this attitude.
npcAttitudes.successResult: The creature becomes Friendly for the duration of the interaction.

npcAttitudes.description: A Friendly creature wants to help the adventurers and wishes for their success. It might not risk its life for them, but it is positively disposed toward them.
npcAttitudes.successResult: The creature will provide direct assistance, such as information, resources, or services.
npcAttitudes.failureConsequence: The creature remains Friendly but may not go out of its way to help.

influenceChecks.description: To influence an NPC's attitude, a character can make a Charisma check using one of the following skills: Deception, Intimidation, Performance, or Persuasion. The DM sets the DC based on the NPC's current attitude and what the character is asking.

modifiers.circumstance: Character offers something the NPC wants
Character appeals to NPC's bonds or ideals
Character has previously wronged the NPC
Character asks for something risky or costly

notes: The Influence action is a formal action in 2024 rules. On your turn, you can use it to make a Charisma check to alter a creature's attitude. The DM determines whether the check is possible and which skill applies.
